1.brief: Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

3.brief: the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to seize by the heel; figuratively, to circumvent (as if tripping up the heels); also to restrain (as if holding by the heel)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

4.brief: properly, to vanquish; by implication, to rule (causatively, crown)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

5.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration

6.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice

7.brief: Kenaan, a son a Ham; also the country inhabited by him
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
(only in the dual) a pair of scales
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

8.brief: Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
properly, to accumulate; chiefly (specifically) to grow (causatively, make) rich
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
toil; hence, a work, produce, property (as the result of labor)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

9.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, an appointment, i.e. a fixed time or season; specifically, a festival; conventionally ayear; by implication, an assembly (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the congregation; by extension, the place of meeting; also a signal (as appointed beforehand)

10.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider

11.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
Gilad, a region East of the Jordan; also the name of three Israelites
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Gilgal, the name of three places in Palestine
to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

12.brief: to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly
Aram or Syria, and its inhabitants; also the name of the son of Shem, a grandson of Nahor, and of an Israelite
to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

13.brief: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

14.brief: to trouble; by implication, to grieve, rage, be indignant
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to pound, i.e. smite; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to disperse; also, to thrust off, down, out or upon (inclusively, reject, let alone, permit, remit, etc.)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
